III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided for R. 400.4156 (3) (b). This rule states the
progress of the youth is to be documented in the updated treatment plan. The

UTP reviews three months of treatment completed. This area should have a
significant amount of information detailing the progress youth have made. The
action steps should be noted as being completed or making progress. This
area should note the activities or treatment that the youth has been involved in
and how the youth are progressing.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No Consultation was requested or needed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
The agency does not have any financial issues. Interviews with staff and residents
reveal the agency is fulfilling all of the needs of the children.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The CA Assessment was completed. There were no violations last year and no
negative trends noted for the agency. There were four unplanned removals. All
four involved either violent outburst from youth while on home passes or in the
facility. None of them presented a pattern that revealed a systematic issue.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted and there are no issues to note. Youth who were
interviewed were interviewed and did not disclose any issues. Youth discussed
their current programming and were able to provide positive information

concerning what they are learning. All reported staff are supportive and help them
with treatment books. Youth were all well dressed and reported their needs are
being met. Staff were knowledgeable concerning their program and youth they
serve.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained and has an inviting atmosphere. There were no
safety concerns observed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
